post_content:
ZDI Announces Rules, Prizes for Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020
...which invites white hat hackers to demonstrate their smartphone and IoT device exploits
July 29, 2020
https://www.securityweek.com/zdi-announces-rules-prizes-pwn2own-tokyo-2020
Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020 will take place on November 3-5 and it will coincide with the PacSec conference, which typically takes place in Tokyo that time of year. However, due to the coronavirus pandemic, PacSec has been turned into a virtual event.

In the case of Pwn2Own Tokyo, the event will actually be held in Toronto, Canada, but interested researchers have been given the option to participate remotely. Participants will need to submit a whitepaper detailing their exploit chain and instructions for running the exploit, which will be run by a ZDI staff member in Toronto.

Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020 focuses on exploits aimed at smartphones, including the Google Pixel 4, Samsung Galaxy S20, Huawei P40, Apple’s iPhone 11, and the Xiaomi Mi 10.
Click to expand...
Participants can earn up to $160,000 for hacking the iPhone 11 or Pixel 4 via a web browser, if their exploits are executed with kernel privileges and the payload can survive a reboot of the device.

Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020 also covers wearables. Hackers can earn $60,000 for achieving remote code execution on Facebook’s Oculus Quest VR headset and $80,000 for remote code execution on the 5th series Apple Watch.
Click to expand...
Additional details and the complete rules for Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020 are available on ZDI's website.
Click to expand...
Announcing Pwn2Own Tokyo 2020 – Live from Toronto!
So boring, why no software hacks? I would like to see browser sandbox escapes.
